We want to put the largest digit in the highest place value. 

Which digit is the largest?

$\maroonD6$ is the largest digit, and we want to put it in the position with the highest place value.   

  So $\maroonD6$ will be in the thousands place: 
 $\maroonD{6}{,}$ $\_$ $\_$ $\_$

Now we need to do the same thing with the next largest digit:  $\blueD2$.  

  So  $\blueD2$ goes in the hundreds place:  

$\maroonD{6}{,}$$\blueD2$ $\_$ $\_$

The next largest digit is the $\greenD1$.  The $\greenD1$ goes in the place to the right of hundreds--the tens place:  

$\maroonD{6}{,}$$\blueD2$$\greenD1$  $\_$

The smallest digit is the $\purpleC0$.  The  $\purpleC0$ goes in the ones place:  

$\maroonD{6}{,}\blueD2\greenD1\purpleC0$

The greatest possible number we can make is $\maroonD{6}{,}\blueD2\greenD1\purpleC0$.
